transcript.text: Hi Jamie, thanks for joining. Before we dive in, I want to introduce who we have on the Manus side today. With me is Priya Desai, our Director of IT Solutions and technical lead for enterprise implementations.
Hi Jamie, great to meet you. I’ll be helping ensure Manus fits into your workflow, security framework, and research processes.

Great to meet both of you. On our side, I'm representing our Deal Strategy and Investor Relations team, but for next steps, you might also want to CC our Head of Research, Ethan Walsh—he oversees all pre-meeting prep packets and diligence materials.
Perfect, thanks. To get started, could you share what prompted Silverline Capital to look into Manus? What pain points are showing up internally?

The biggest theme is that our team is overwhelmed preparing customized pitches for every investor and every prospective portfolio company. Each meeting requires deep industry research, competitive analysis, and personalized value-prop framing. It shouldn’t take hours—but it does.
Is the challenge mainly the research phase, the pitch creation phase, or both?

Both. For each prospect, our associates spend hours gathering articles, investor memos, past fundraising rounds, risk factors, and industry benchmarks. Then they rewrite everything to tailor the pitch narrative. It’s not scalable. We have 40–60 investor conversations a week during peak cycles.
That load definitely aligns with what Manus automates. What has Silverline tried so far to ease the burden?

We’ve tried using ChatGPT internally, but the issue is inconsistency. We can’t rely on associates to use it the same way, and it doesn’t integrate into our CRM or data room. We also tried templates, but customization still takes too long. Leadership wants a standardized output that still feels tailored.
Makes sense. Manus can auto-generate customized decks, research briefs, and pitch narratives from your CRM fields and knowledge base. What level of customization are you aiming for?

Ideally, Manus should take a prospect’s background, past interactions, industry, and fund profile—and produce a pitch that's 90% ready. For us, anything under 30 minutes per pitch would be a huge win. Right now some take two to four hours.
Understood. How does the investment research process look today? Walk us through a typical meeting prep workflow.

Sure. An associate starts by checking our notes from past conversations, then they search for relevant industry reports, look at comparable deals, and gather macroeconomic insights. Then they scrape news, extract KPIs, and put everything into a brief. After that, they manually craft a narrative tailored to the investor’s priorities. It's deeply manual.
And for decision-makers—who else needs to be part of this evaluation?

Please CC: Ethan Walsh on the research side; our CIO, Katherine Woods, at katherine.woods@silverlinecapital.com; and for any contract steps, loop in finance lead Marcus Bell—he oversees new tooling spend.
Thank you. What are the major blockers slowing down approval on your side?

Two things. First, accuracy. We need Manus to generate briefs that require minimal rewriting, especially when citing market data. Second, compliance. Our CIO wants to validate security posture, data flow diagrams, and retention timelines before we even begin a pilot.

We can provide all compliance assets. On the accuracy side, Manus can use your internal memos and research archives to strengthen industry-specific context. Are you also planning to automate meeting summaries?

Yes. Our IR team wants summaries from investor calls that extract sentiment, risk factors, and next-step asks. They want every stakeholder captured—role, influence level, objections, and decision criteria.
That’s directly in our wheelhouse. How does Silverline evaluate success for a tool like Manus?

Success is: reducing prep time by at least 60%, producing standardized pitch narratives, and auto-generating research briefs that map directly to our CRM fields. Also, we want Manus to suggest talking points for each investor based on their fund profile and past behavior.
We can generate investor-specific insights automatically. What timeline are you targeting for a rollout?
If a pilot goes well, we’d aim for a full launch by early Q3. But finance needs clear ROI projections showing rep hours saved and the impact on deal velocity before approving budget.
We can quantify hours saved per pitch and per research brief. Any other concerns from your side?

Only that Manus must integrate directly with Salesforce and our internal knowledge base. If Manus can pull past memos, prior investment themes, and similar deals to enrich research, that would be game-changing.
We can integrate with both. We can also provide embeddings tuned to your investment frameworks so briefs feel consistent with your brand and thinking.

Great. Then next steps would be: send over your compliance package, a sample personalized pitch output, and a draft workflow for generating customized briefs. Once our CIO signs off, we can start a pilot.
Perfect. We'll share everything and CC your full team.
Looking forward to it. This could meaningfully transform how our research and investor relations teams operate.
